messages.message:
Hey team, I've been asked to qualify a use case for Deloitte on timesheets (shift work). They've passed me these two sample documents, and I'd hoped visual reasoning might be able to help with the handwritten corrections. The task is to extract the tabular data with the handwritten corrections implemented. Table extraction does a decent enough job with the table, but handwritten corrections (e.g. swaps, cancellations, notes) are proving tricky.

My current position is that we should qualify out as I am not getting promising results (https://aihub.instabase.com/build/0194cb90-bc8a-749e-8943-00db36a54798). Any ideas?

cc @jordy.vlan @Kaustubh (KD)

Oomph, rather tricky use-case: table with small print + handwriting. A current downside to our vision reasoning pipeline is that OpenAI only allows us small control over the resolution (either `low`  or `high` ), which does not work well for these examples.
Claude should allow us to control the resolution better, so maybe test in some playground (https://claude.ai/new) if it does any better?

Thanks @jordy.vlan, from what I understand this use case has a tight timeline so wouldn't help here unfortunately. Can we add these to a list of examples to try/benchmark when we look at other providers/improvements?
Also might be a good idea to test Gemini flash 2.0 for free via https://aistudio.google.com/u/2/prompts/new_chat?pli=1 :wink:
results equally bad on these examples though
Yeah we should add these to the benchmarking set. For that confirming that the goldens are just the table + corrections
Also gemini flash is supposed to the "best" in VLM lands so if it performs poorly there we are likely at today's limits with VLMs out of the box.
